title: Spotify Shuffle Not Random? Here's What You Can Do

steps.title: Spotify curates shuffles rather than using a true randomizer.
steps.content: Spotify curates shuffles rather than using a true randomizer. This feature is meant to seamlessly blend songs into a playlist you want to hear based on your past listens, but it can be frustrating when you want to listen to songs in a different order. As of right now, there's no way to force Spotify to change its shuffle other than the new Smart Shuffle feature that suggests new songs while you listen. If you want Spotify to add a pure shuffle function, you can vote on a Live Idea that suggests this feature. Do the following: Go to the Live Idea community post . [1] X Research source Click or tap VOTE on the right side. Log into your Spotify account if prompted. Your vote will be added. If enough users support the idea, the Spotify team will work to implement it.

steps.title: Clear your cache.
steps.content: Clear your cache. Your cache contains information about your listening history, searches, and more. If you've never cleared your cache before, Spotify may be taking up more storage on your device than it needs to. Do the following: Select your profile icon. Select Settings . Scroll down to Cache . Select Clear cache .

steps.title: Update the Spotify app.
steps.content: Update the Spotify app. Bugs can be unpredictable and may affect the shuffle.

steps.title: Log out and log back in again.
steps.content: Log out and log back in again. Select your account in the top-right corner, and then select Log out . Then, enter your information again.

steps.title: Look for outages.
steps.content: Look for outages. Check DownDetector or the official Spotify Twitter (X) for outages.
